# 3 Examples of Travel Email Marketing We Love

Apr 27, 2022   |   2 min read

Knowledge Center  ❯   Blog

It’s finally the season for travel, leisure and those long-awaited summer
vacations your prospects have been dreaming about. While some people love the
process of choosing a destination, the hotel and other aspects of a getaway,
it can also feel like information overload-especially when the hopeful
traveler visits 38 travel sites, on average, before booking.

For marketers in the travel sector, email is an effective way to capitalize on
consumer travel plans. And with so many travel websites, hotel options and
destinations to choose from, businesses that specialize in travel and leisure
can leverage email to stay top of mind among busy consumers as they plan their
much-needed vacations.

Here are three examples of travel emails that do an incredible job engaging
and entertaining wandering vacation shoppers:

* * *

## 1\. Travel + Leisure

While the important components of travel are usually the first things that
come to mind when planning a trip-like where to eat at your destination and
how much time to leave for airport security-there are other key factors that
can make or break our travel plans. Travel + Leisure‘s online destination for
travel tips, guides, news and information uses email marketing to share timely
and interesting stories about some of the less conspicuous things one needs to
consider when traveling.

In the following clip from Travel + Leisure’s email newsletter, readers
receive a digest of popular blog posts with helpful travel information, like
tips for flying with young children. Subscribers are encouraged to read more
on the blog and further engage with the company’s site.

* * *

## 2\. Tablet Hotels

We love Tablet‘s approach to travel email marketing because it aligns so
nicely with the brand’s target audience: people who love luxury vacations and
hotels. The email’s clean, modern look and feel matches that of the hotel
options Tablet offers. In addition, the email excels at incorporating clever
copywriting and stunning imagery-so stunning that it’s worth clicking through
to take a peek even if you’re not in the market for a luxury hotel.

* * *

## 3\. Sixt

This email from Sixt joins our lineup of great examples for how it delights
and rewards its customers. Every email is full of personality, including this
one celebrating Cinco de Mayo with fun imagery and read-worthy copy. Along
with offering a deal to rent a BMW or Mercedes-Benz, the email includes copy
in both English and Spanish to incorporate some extra Cinco de Mayo flair.

All of these examples delight readers with useful information, compelling
design or engaging personality that’s targeted to their recipients.
Incorporate these ideas into your email strategy, and you’re well on your way
to building a highly engaged audience.

**An irresistible email marketing strategy starts with having valuable data
about your customers. Demographics and purchase data give you the insights to
send targeted, compelling emails.Learn more about email demographic appending
today!**

AtData Adds Quality Score to Its Suite of Email Address Intelligence Solutions

AtData releases its machine learning based Quality Score to help organizations
better segment and qualify customer databases to improve email campaign
engagement, deliverability, response and conversions.

Press Releases

Navigating the New Era of Email: Google and Yahoo’s Spam Filtering Changes

Come February 2024, businesses that rely on email marketing will face new
challenges as Google and Yahoo roll out significant updates to spam filtering
policies. However, the change extends beyond email marketing, potentially
impacting any business that uses email communication.

Blog

Understanding Google’s New Inactive Policy and What it Means for Your Business

Google, known for continuously updating its policies for better user
experience and safety, recently announced a significant change to its inactive
account policy.

Blog
